p: To understand the effect of honey on cholesterol homeostasis at molecular levels, we explored the expression of associated genes in HepG2 cells ( AMPKα, SREBP-2, HMGCR, LDLR, LXRα and PPARα) using RT qPCR analysis ( Figure 6). As honey is composed of sugar and non-sugar components, an analogue which consists of sugars similar to the composition of honeys (40% fructose, 35% glucose and 5% sucrose) was examined for the effect of the sugars on the genes and relative contrast to the tested honeys.
